comment._content: Wikipedia on General Sir Ian Standish Monteith Hamilton, who is most remembered for "commanding the ill-fated Mediterranean Expeditionary Force during the Battle of Gallipoli."

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.stepneyrobarts.co.uk/457.htm has a longish biographical piece and a copy of an oil painting portrait. His papers are at King's College, London. www.kingscollections.org/catalogues/lhcma/collection/f-j/...

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Pictured in the very colorful full dress uniform of the Queen's Own Cameron Highlanders. ww2today.com/captain-leah-is-captured-near-la-bassee Other Bain portraits of the general: It looks to me like this portrait was taken at the same time as the one on the right, only he is holding his plumed helmet in this one.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to all of you for your great research. We'll fill in the caption the next time we update.

comment.author: 36645048@N00
comment._content: This photograph must date between 1900 when he was made a KCB (see star and neck badge) and 1910 when he was made a GCB. In fact it probably can be narrowed further, he was on secondment to the Japanese army during the Russo-Japanese War (1904-05) which is presumably when he was given the Japanese Order of the Sacred Treasure 1st Class (sash and breast star).
